snippet: Airlines and airports are testing a guidance system that could reduce congestion and fuel consumption by allowing planes to take a more direct route to the runway.
abstract: Airlines and airports are testing a satellite technology-based guidance system that could reduce congestion and fuel consumption by allowing planes to take a more direct route to the runway; Alaska Airlines flights will begin extensive testing of the system to land at Seattle-Tacoma International Airport; system, if adopted nationwide, would replace the radar-based air traffic control system in place since the 1940s.
lead_paragraph: Airlines and airports are testing a guidance system that could reduce congestion and fuel consumption by allowing planes to take a more direct route to the runway.

headline.seo: A Satellite System That Could End Circling Above the Airport
headline.main: A Satellite System That Could End Circling Above the Airport
